alert.note: Alert for Wallowa County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 11 at 9:33AM PDT until June 14 at 6:30PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pendleton OR has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Washington...Oregon... Grande Ronde River at Troy affecting Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties, Wallowa County and Northeast Blue Mountains zones. For the Grande Ronde River...Troy...flooding is possible. Fld Observed Forecasts (11 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Grande Ronde River Troy 10.0 8.6 Sat 9 am PDT 9.7 10.6 10.2 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pdt. ORZ050-WAZ031-032-121645- /O.NEW.KPDT.FL.A.0004.220613T0300Z-220615T0130Z/ /TRYO3.0.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.UU/ 933 AM PDT Sat Jun 11 2022 ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING TO TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Grande Ronde River at Troy. * WHEN...From Sunday evening to Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Extensive flooding of fields around Troy are possible, but no residences are threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM PDT Saturday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
